content: I have two remarks: I fail to see how a 6 point system is overloading with options, or how a 10 point system is limiting.This is a clever solution, however while looking at your example in figure 2, you are actually placing your elements on the baseline, not type itself. This contrasts with the philosophy of placing type on the baseline, and adjusting the elements around that… In other words, I would be interested of checking the vertical rhythm not of your elements, but of your type.
